Material used.Description: DSC experiments were performed using untagged wild-type, A104T, M26I, and E163K DJ-1 at 10-20 μM concentration.

Readout description.Result Description: A104T mutation reduces the melting temperature (Tm) of DJ-1 to 58.7°C compared to wild-type (66.2°C), indicating significant thermal destabilization.
E163K mutation reduces the melting temperature (Tm) of DJ-1 to 55.1°C compared to wild-type (66.2°C), indicating substantial thermal destabilization.
M26I mutation reduces the melting temperature (Tm) of DJ-1 to 63.4°C compared to wild-type (66.2°C), indicating modest thermal destabilization.

Technical replicates.Description: T m values differ by 1°C or less in replicate DSC experiments on a representative DJ-1 sample.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a reference for comparison with mutant proteins.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Melting temperature (Tm) around 66.2°C as observed for wild-type DJ-1.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Melting temperature (Tm) significantly below 66.2°C, indicating thermal destabilization.

Material used.Description: Sedimentation equilibrium ultracentrifugation was performed using tag-cleaved protein samples.

Readout description.Result Description: A104T mutation does not disrupt dimerization; exists as a dimer in solution.
E163K mutation does not disrupt dimerization; exists as a dimer in solution.
M26I mutation does not disrupt dimerization; exists as a dimer in solution.

Technical replicates.Description: Absorbance scans were collected after 20 hours and 22 hours of centrifugation for every sample to ensure equilibrium.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a reference for comparison with mutant proteins.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Data were analyzed using Origin 6.0 data analysis software with various self-association models.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein exists as a dimer in solution, fitting a dimeric model with no evidence of monomeric or higher-order oligomeric states.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Presence of monomeric or higher-order oligomeric states indicating disruption of dimerization.

Material used.Description: CD spectra were collected using tag-cleaved DJ-1 proteins diluted to 10 μM.

Readout description.Result Description: A104T mutation does not significantly alter the secondary structural content of DJ-1 in solution.
E163K mutation does not significantly alter the secondary structural content of DJ-1 in solution.
M26I mutation does not significantly alter the secondary structural content of DJ-1 in solution.

Technical replicates.Description: Spectra were measured with an accumulation of five scans per spectrum.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a reference for comparison with mutant proteins.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Approximate estimates of secondary structural content were obtained using a Kohonen neural network (K2D program).

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Secondary structural content approximately 35% α-helix, 18% β-strand, and 47% coil/turn/other, matching wild-type DJ-1.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation from wild-type secondary structural content indicating structural disruption.

Material used.Description: Crystallization experiments used DJ-1 at 20 mg/ml, including 6xHis-tagged and tag-cleaved forms of A104T, E163K, M26I, and engineered variants.

Readout description.Result Description: A104T introduces disorder and water into the hydrophobic core of DJ-1, causing structural perturbations near critical residue C106.
E163K disrupts a key salt bridge with R145, increasing mobility and disorder in the dimer interface region.
M26I causes minor packing defects in the core of the DJ-1 dimer due to steric conflict and loss of packing contacts.

Technical replicates.Description: Data were collected in separate high and low resolution passes to avoid overloaded pixels.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 crystal structures (e.g., PDB 1P5F) were used as reference models for comparison.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Refinement statistics including R and R free values were calculated using SHELX-97 and REFMAC5.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Structural integrity similar to wild-type DJ-1 with no significant disorder or packing defects.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Presence of structural perturbations, disorder, or packing defects as observed in mutant structures.
